projects.title: Poster Presentation Creation
projects.description: This project is about graphic design and creating a high-quality presentation for class assignments or conference presentations. The process of creating an attractive poster presentation is about understanding graphic design and building skill in software specifically designed for creating this type of content.

project_content.section_heading: The best way to begin a poster project
paragraphs: The goal of a poster project is to present information in a way that is both compelling and visually interesting. Posters combine textual information with images, graphs, charts, and other visual content. Before starting the process of placing text and visual elements onto a poster board, it's important to do good research and collect all the information needed to create an impact with the poster. This includes doing things like outlining the main points of the information to be placed on the poster, gather associated visual and/or graphical content, and spend time to brainstorm and sketch out with pen and paper (or tablet and stylus) some concepts for a poster

Another helpful step to take before diving into the creating a poster presentation is to look for examples of work by others. Searching the Internet for poster presentations on similar topics by other students or scholars can help open the imagination to many ideas. Poster presentations are very common and often follow some typical conventions. Finding examples that demonstrate these conventions can be very useful and provide inspiration to get the process started. Often the most difficult part of the process for creative work is just getting started, so finding good examples helps to get some possible ideas and examples to follow.

Although there are many different types of graphical software available to create posters, many professionals in graphic design rely upon Adobe products. In particular, Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator are industry standard tools that students and professionals use to manipulate photos and images and to create original designs. Learning these tools also has the added advantage of introduce students to a wide range of graphic design techniques and workflows that are used by professionals.

For example, both Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator allow users to create 'artboards', which constitute the usable space for laying out graphical elements. Artboards are flexible and students can specify their dimensions to match the poster size they wish to produce. Artboards can also be oriented in either landscape or portrait alignment, and multiple artboards can be created in one source file for posters that require more than one panel.

The key feature of both Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator is the ability to import media files, create typographical and shape elements, and to apply a huge number of different filters, adjustments, and organizational options to the content of a poster. For example, images in Photoshop can be adjusted for exposure or color balance, text can be added on top of images, and shapes in many different sizes and colors can be added to create interest in the design. Likewise, Adobe Illustrator allows students to import graphics, but also to use drawing tools to add brushstrokes and custom shapes to a design.

Both software programs include powerful processing features such as the ability to blur or rotate elements with precision. The results for students creating posters is the ability to add images, graphics, text, shapes, and customize the presentation of each independently. Students can create poster presentations that are unique and eye-catching.

The unanswered question is - how can students learn how to use these software programs? Because they are both complex and powerful programs, they require some practice to learn how to use them effectively.

Thankfully the library has a mountain of learning resources that can help. Students can choose to borrow a print book, access and e-book, or watch learning videos - all available via the library. Depending on the preferred style of learning, there's likely to be some type of content available to help.

In order to access learning content, the first step is to visit the library website and search for either Adobe Photoshop or Illustrator. The list of results will include a combination of print, e-book, and audio-visual content. To access online content, it's necessary to enter your student ID and password. Content can also be search, which is useful when students need to find details about a particular operation in the software or learn more about a specific technique. The end result is that students can create compelling poster presentations that are dynamic and unique while also learning about graphic design.

project_content.section_heading: The best way to begin the project
paragraphs: The goal of a poster project is to present information in a way that is both compelling and visually interesting. Posters combine textual information with images, graphs, charts, and other visual content. Before starting the process of placing text and visual elements onto a poster board, it's important to do good research and collect all the information needed to create an impact with the poster. This includes doing things like outlining the main points of the information to be placed on the poster, gather associated visual and/or graphical content, and spend time to brainstorm and sketch out with pen and paper (or tablet and stylus) some concepts for a poster

Another helpful step to take before diving into the creating a poster presentation is to look for examples of work by others. Searching the Internet for poster presentations on similar topics by other students or scholars can help open the imagination to many ideas. Poster presentations are very common and often follow some typical conventions. Finding examples that demonstrate these conventions can be very useful and provide inspiration to get the process started. Often the most difficult part of the process for creative work is just getting started, so finding good examples helps to get some possible ideas and examples to follow.
